intro: Dicalix theophrastifolia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Dicalix theophrastifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
